page.title: 14Cable Television
page.content: Cults and Bieldside in Aberden are two of the first places in Britain to receive Cable television.Cable television isn't just BBC1,BBC2,ITV and channel4.It consists of 15 channels cover a variety of topics such as music, sport and films. The service costs Â£4 a week. Cable television works when signals are beamed up to a satellite.Then the satellite transmits to Aberdeen's dish aerial.It then goes through Cable again to your decoder box which can sit neatly on your television. In the future cable television hope to introduce home banking, home shopping and computor games on cable.
